name: Panko-Crusted Spinach Dip
description: This gooey, cheesy crowdpleaser comes together in barely any time. It's a super simple blend of frozen spinach, mayo, sour cream, and cream cheese with a little bit of garlic and chili flakes to give it a kick. Topped with crunchy panko and Parmesan and baked until bubbling, it's the sort of dip that could easily spoil more than a few appetites.
recipeIngredient: Three 16-ounce bags frozen spinach, defrosted and drained
Two 8-ounce packages cream cheese, at room temperature

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium mixing bowl, combine the spinach, sour cream, mayonnaise, Parmesan, red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, and salt. Add the cream cheese to the bowl and stir until all the ingredients are fully incorporated. Pour the mixture into a cast-iron skillet or ovenproof baking dish.
Combine the topping ingredients in a small bowl. Sprinkle the topping over the dip mixture in an even layer.

Bake for 20 minutes, until bubbling. Raise the heat to 450°F and bake for another 5 to 10 minutes, until the top is golden brown. Serve immediately. Though this is best hot, it turns out to be delicious at room temperature, too.
